author: mratsim
content:
I've implemented Gt multiexp to evaluate how fast we can make Whisk/Curdleproofs.
Overhead is 3x over G1 for single exponentiation and 5x for MSM/multiexp (due to batch affine transformation)

15ms for a 256 Gt multiexp on a Ryzen 7840U (low power 15W~30W CPU)

Details: https://ethresear.ch/t/the-return-of-torus-based-cryptography-whisk-and-curdleproof-in-the-target-group/16678/3?u=mratsim
And for single exponentiation constant-time only costs 10% vs vartime.
